metadata.Title: CVE-2017-11281 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - critical
metadata.Description:
Adobe Flash Player has an exploitable memory corruption vulnerability inthe text handling function. Successful exploitation could lead to arbitrarycode execution. This affects 26.0.0.151 and earlier.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11281` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

flashplugin-downloader - 27.0.0.130ubuntu0.14.04.1
flashplugin-installer - 27.0.0.130ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: flashplugin-nonfree package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '27.0.0.130ubuntu0.14.04.1').
